title: Chief Minister KP acknowledges valuable services of nurses
content:
PESHAWAR, May 12 (APP):Chief Minister Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Wednesday congratulated the entire country, especially the nursing community of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on the occasion of International Nurses’ Day.
In his message in connection with the International Nursing Day, the Chief Minister Mahmood Khan said that today is the day to highlight the importance of nurses in the society and acknowledge of their valuable services.
Nursing is a respected profession, the Chief Minister said, adding, “Nursing is the backbone of the health system.”
Chief Minister KP Mahmood Khan said that Nursing is another name for selfless service to humanity and in the current situation of Corona, the nursing community is rendering valuable services.
He said Nurses like doctors and other medical staff are doing selfless service to save the lives of Corona patients.
The Chief Minister KP said that the provincial government values the services and sacrifices of nurses. “On this day, I salute the nurses for their passion for service,” Chief Minister Mahmood Khan said, adding, “The provincial government will continue to take steps for the welfare of nurses.”
“Salute to your hard work and wish you a very Happy Nurse Day,” the Chief Minister KP said, adding, “We can sleep comfortably because we know that someone is there to take care of our loved ones, someone is there to give them medicines on time and you are doing a wonderful job so warm wishes to you on International Nursing Day.
The theme for this year’s International Nurses Day is Nurses: A Voice to Lead-A Vision for Future Healthcare. Like doctors and other health care workers, nurses are at the forefront of fighting the Covid-19 pandemic.
